name: Subscription
description: Subscription holds the top-level calls that return streams of data. Call them with the `subscription` keyword from your top-level GraphQL query

fields.name: blocks
fields.description:
Listen to a stream of blocks as they come in.
WARN: always consider the `undo` field in forward searches, which signal that the matching element
(a block) was in fact REMOVED from the chain because of blocks reorganization.

arguments.name: lowBlockNum
arguments.description: Lower block num boundary, inclusive. A negative value means a block relative to the head block. Omitting this value means unbounded (since the genesis block).

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description: Opaque data piece that you can pass back to continue your stream if it ever disconnected. Retrieve it from the `cursor` field in the responses of this call.

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Limit the number of results streamed back. 0 means unlimited

fields.name: searchTransactions
fields.description:
Search the blockchain forward for transaction *execution traces* based on `query`.
See the [Search Query Language](/platform/public-apis/search-query-language) page for more info.

WARN: always consider the `undo` field in forward searches, which signal that the matching element
was in fact REMOVED from the chain because of blocks reorganization.  The `undo` field is always `false` in backward searches.

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: dfuse Search Query Language string

arguments.name: lowBlockNum
arguments.description: Lower block num boundary, inclusive. A negative value means a block relative to the head block. Omitting this value means unbounded (since the genesis block).

arguments.name: highBlockNum
arguments.description: Higher block num boundary, inclusive. A value of 0 means live-searching on any incoming blocks (the default behavior). A negative value means a block relative to the head block, ex: -1 means the head block, -2 means the second to last block, etc..

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description: Opaque data piece that you can pass back to continue your search if it ever disconnected. Retrieve it from the `cursor` field in the responses of this call. It is safe to use the same cursor in BOTH directions (forward and backward).

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Limit the number of results streamed back. 0 means unlimited

arguments.name: sort
arguments.description: From which end to start. ASC means from the past, going into the future. DESC means recent to older transactions.

arguments.name: liveMarkerInterval
arguments.description:
If non-zero, indicates you want to mark the stream when reaching live blocks. A marker is a response with a `trace` equal to `null`, which will be sent at each `liveMarkerInterval` blocks. The first `trace` to be equal to `null` in a stream indicates you are now processing live blocks.

The value for `liveMarkerInterval` is a number of blocks.

fields.name: transactionLifecycle
fields.description:
Subscribe to a transaction to follow its lifecycle (inclusion in a block, confirmations, etc.).
The transaction can be in an `unknown` or `pending` state at the time of the request.
See the [Transaction Lifecycle](/ethereum/public-apis/concepts/trx_lifecycle/) page for more info.

arguments.name: hash
arguments.description: hash of the transaction you want to track the state

name: Query
description: Query holds the top-level calls that return single responses of data. Call them with the `query` keyword from your top-level GraphQL query

fields.name: block
fields.description: Get a single block by its hash

fields.name: blockByNumber
fields.description: Get a single block by its number

fields.name: transaction
fields.description: Get a single transaction by its hash

fields.name: _alphaExecute
fields.description: ALPHA Speculatively execute a transaction and get back the TransactionTrace it produced

arguments.name: atBlock
arguments.description: `BlockRef` defines against which block height the execution should be performed against, optional, if not present, use HEAD block (as seen by dfuse). For best precision, use the `hash`. Passing only the num will use the longest block chain for this block number.

fields.name: _alphaReplay
fields.description: ALPHA Speculatively replay a transaction id and get back the TransactionTrace it produced

arguments.name: atBlock
arguments.description: `BlockRef` defines against which block height the execution should be performed against, optional, if not present, use the block in which the transaction was executed. For best precision, use the `hash`. Passing only the num will use the longest block chain for this block number.

fields.name: searchTransactions
fields.description:
Search the blockchain forward for transaction *execution traces* based on `query`.
See the [Search Query Language](/platform/public-apis/search-query-language) page for more info.

WARN: always consider the `undo` field in forward searches, which signal that the matching element
was in fact REMOVED from the chain because of blocks reorganization.  The `undo` field is always `false` in backward searches.

arguments.name: indexName
arguments.description: The index that will be queried (CALLS or LOGS), see the [Search Terms for Ethereums](/ethereum/public-apis/reference/search-terms/) page for more info.

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: See the [Search Query Language](/platform/public-apis/search-query-language) page for more info.

arguments.name: lowBlockNum
arguments.description: Lower boundary for search. Use -1 for HEAD. See the [Search Ranges for Ethereums](/ethereum/public-apis/concepts/search-ranges/) page for more info.

arguments.name: highBlockNum
arguments.description: Upper boundary for search. Use -1 for HEAD. See the [Search Ranges for Ethereums](/ethereum/public-apis/concepts/search-ranges/) page for more info.

arguments.name: cursor
arguments.description: See the [Understanding Cursors](/platform/public-apis/understanding-cursors) page for more info.

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Maximum number of results to include in a result

arguments.name: sort
arguments.description: Direction in which to perform the search

name: PageInfo
description: Cursors required to continue either forward or backwards from a list of paginated elements

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: cursor of the first element of the list, use it to search in the opposite direction

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: cursor of the last element of the list, use it to continue

name: TransactionConnection
description: The Connection type for a Transaction. See the [GraphQL Semantics](/platform/public-apis/graphql-semantics) page for more info.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges to transactions

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid pagination

name: TransactionEdge
description:
A single transaction response.

WARNING: when doing forward streaming searches, do NOT forget to include the `undo` field to determine if the message is actually a REVERSAL of the transaction.

NOTE: always check the value of `node.status` to make sure it is successfully executed before assuming it is.

fields.name: undo
fields.description:
Whether this response is an UNDO operation of a previously sent response.

In a forward search, make sure you catch this and always verify its value.. as to not double/triple count transactions.

In a backward searches, `undo` will always be `false`.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Query cursor, allowing you to continue fetching results even after interruption of your connection, without missing a beat.

fields.name: block
fields.description: `block` is the block in which this transaction was mined

fields.name: node
fields.description: The TransactionTrace object.

fields.name: to
fields.description: `to` is the recipient address of a transfer, or target contract of a call.  [VERIFY: will be empty for contract-creating calls / if untrue, resurface the `create: true` variable like in a TransactioNTrace for consistency.]

fields.name: nonce
fields.description: `nonce` is an ever incrementing counter of transactions issued by the `from` account.

fields.name: gasPrice
fields.description: `gasPrice` is the price offered to miners for gas, in wei per unit.

fields.name: gasLimit
fields.description: `gasLimit` is the maximum amount of gas this transaction can consume. Other Ethereum nodes often name this field simply `gas`. Alias the field name if you prefer. See the [GraphQL Queries and Mutation — Aliases](https://graphql.org/learn/queries/#aliases) section for more info about aliases.

fields.name: value
fields.description: `value` is the Ether value (in wei) sent along with this transaction.

fields.name: inputData
fields.description: `inputData` is the data supplied to the target contract of the transaction. It is sometimes named `input` elsewhere.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: `hash` is the hash of this transaction. It is also a universally unique pointer to this transaction.

fields.name: from
fields.description: `from` is the account that sent this transaction - this will always be an externally owned account in the context of this object.

fields.name: signature
fields.description: `signature` holds the V, R and S values representing the cryptographic signature for this transaction. It is based on these values that the `from` address is derived

name: TransactionTraceConnection
description: The Connection type for a TransactionTrace

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges to transaction traces

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid pagination

name: TransactionTraceEdge
description:
A single transaction trace response.

WARNING: when doing forward streaming searches, do NOT forget to include the `undo` field to determine if the message is actually a REVERSAL of the transaction.

NOTE: always check the value of `node.status` to make sure it is successfully executed before assuming it is.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Query cursor, allowing you to continue fetching results even after interruption of your connection, without missing a beat.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The transaction trace object.

name: TransactionTrace
description:
Traces of the execution of a given transaction. This means the
transaction was executed on the chain. You also get context about the
block in which it was executed, and the status of the execution.

WARN: Make sure to always check the `status` to make sure you're not
considering a failed transaction as if it was successful.

fields.name: to
fields.description:
`to` is the recipient address of a transfer, or target contract of a call.

NOTE: this field will *always* be set, even when the transaction creates a contract.  To distinguish contract creations, use the `create` field.

fields.name: nonce
fields.description: `nonce` is an ever incrementing counter of transactions issued by the `from` account.

fields.name: gasPrice
fields.description: `gasPrice` is the price offered to miners for gas, in wei per unit. You can encode it differently with the `encoding` parameter.

fields.name: gasLimit
fields.description: `gasLimit` is the maximum amount of gas this transaction can consume. Other Ethereum nodes often name this field simply `gas`. Alias the field name if you prefer. See the [GraphQL Queries and Mutation — Aliases](https://graphql.org/learn/queries/#aliases) page for more info about aliases.

fields.name: value
fields.description: `value` is the Ether value (in wei) sent along with this transaction.

fields.name: inputData
fields.description: `inputData` is the data supplied to the target contract of the transaction. It is sometimes named `input` elsewhere.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: `hash` is the hash of this transaction. It is also a universally unique pointer to this transaction.

fields.name: from
fields.description: `from` is the account that sent this transaction - this will always be an externally owned account in the context of this object.

fields.name: signature
fields.description: `signature` holds the V, R and S values representing the cryptographic signature for this transaction. It is based on these values that the `from` address is derived

fields.name: status
fields.description: `status` shows if the transaction was successful, failed or was reverted.  You have the details on the Calls as to which execution is responsible for the failure, and traces up to that point.

fields.name: gasUsed
fields.description: `gasUsed` is the quantity of gas units that was consumed processing this transaction.

fields.name: cumulativeGasUsed
fields.description: `cumulativeGasUsed` is the quantity of gas units that was consumed processing this transaction plus all the gas units user by all the transaction before this one in the block.

fields.name: publicKey
fields.description: TODO: detail, which type of encoding.. and is it even present?

fields.name: index
fields.description: `index` is the 0-based index of this transaction's execution within the block. TODO: REVIEW

fields.name: create
fields.description: `create` is true when the transaction represents a contract deployment

fields.name: block
fields.description: `block` is the block in which this transaction was mined.

fields.name: allLogs
fields.description: `allLogs` is a list of all log events within the transaction, flattened and ordered by execution time.

fields.name: flatCalls
fields.description: Lists all calls, flattened and ordered by execution time.

fields.name: matchingCalls
fields.description: Returns a flattened list of calls, in _execution_ order, of only the matching elements (from a search, or other filtering).

fields.name: matchingLogs
fields.description: Returns a flattened list of logs, in _execution_ order, of only the matching elements (from a search, or other filtering).

fields.name: from
fields.description: `from` is the address of the caller that will

fields.name: to
fields.description: `to` is the address of the contract being executed

fields.name: gasConsumed
fields.description: `gasConsumed` is the amount of gas **specifically** consumed by this call. We use the term **specifically** since for transaction call (i.e. the first call), it does not include implicit transaction gas cost.

fields.name: gasLimit
fields.description: `gasLimit` is the maximum gas value **specifically** set by this call. We use the term **specifically** since for transaction call (i.e. the first call), this limit here will be reduced by the implicit transaction gas cost.

fields.name: status
fields.description: `status` represents the outcome of the execution of this Call

fields.name: failureCause
fields.description:
Defines the cause of the failure. Will be set only when `status` is either `REVERTED` or `FAILED`. The reason is a free form string extracted from the Ethereum node that executed the call.

IMPORTANT: This field has no backward policy and the value could change at any moment. Use it for logging purposes, direct user display, debugging help etc. Use it for logic decisions at your own risk.

name: BlockRefWithHeader
description: `BlockRefWithHeader` is an object that refers to a block and contains its header. Think of it as an incomplete `Block` object.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: Hash (or ID) of this block. It is a unique pointer to this block.

fields.name: number
fields.description: Sequential number of this block on the chain. Unlike the hash, it is not unique because of forked blocks.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: Hash (or ID) of this block. It is a unique pointer to this block.

fields.name: number
fields.description: Sequential number of this block on the chain. Unlike the hash, it is not unique because of forked blocks.

fields.name: uncles
fields.description: List of the block header of the uncles (ommers) of this block

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: List of transactions contained in this block with pagination parameters following the standard GraphQL connection model

fields.name: parentHash
fields.description: Hash of the parent block

fields.name: coinbase
fields.description: Address of the block miner

fields.name: stateRoot
fields.description: Hash of the state trieâ€™s root node

fields.name: logsBloom
fields.description: Bloom Filter, used to optimize searching for transactions inside this block

fields.name: number
fields.description: Sequential number of this block on the chain. Unlike the hash, it is not unique because of forked blocks.

fields.name: gasLimit
fields.description: Maximum amount of gas allowed in a block (determines how many transactions can fit into it)

fields.name: gasUsed
fields.description: Total amount of gas used during execution of all transactions

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Timestamp of the mining of that block

fields.name: extraData
fields.description: Arbitrary data injected by the miner of this block

fields.name: nonce
fields.description: Proof of work nonce - The random value in a block that was used get the proof of work satisfied

fields.name: hash
fields.description: Hash (or ID) of this block. It is a unique pointer to this block.

fields.name: undo
fields.description:
Whether this response is an UNDO operation of a previously sent response.

Make sure you catch this and always verify its value, as to not double/triple count blocks.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Stream cursor, allowing you to continue fetching results even after interruption of your connection, without missing a beat.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The block object.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: Hash (or ID) of this block. It is a unique pointer to this block.

fields.name: number
fields.description: Sequential number of this block on the chain. Unlike the hash, it is not unique because of forked blocks.

fields.name: uncles
fields.description: List of the block header of the uncles (ommers) of this block

fields.name: transactionTraces
fields.description: List of transaction traces contained in this block with pagination parameters following the standard GraphQL connection model

fields.name: previousState
fields.description: previousState is the previous of the transaction. When the stream is initiated this will be UNKNOWN

fields.name: currentState
fields.description: currentState is the current known state of the transaction.

fields.name: transitionName
fields.description: transitionName is the current transition of the transaction.

fields.name: transition
fields.description:
transition holds the details of the specific transition. This can be one of the following types based on the specific transition:
- TrxTransitionInit
- TrxTransitionPooled
- TrxTransitionMined
- TrxTransitionForked
- TrxTransitionConfirmed
- TrxTransitionReplaced
